page.name: Comparing and Contrasting
page.content:
One in five U.S. adults (21 percent) has difficulty completing the tasks that require the literacy skills to compare and contrast information, paraphrase, or make low-level inferences. Educators can help learners develop these skills by having them create lists of the benefits and drawbacks of various activities. Consider having them make a plus and minus list of learning literacy skills, or even purchasing a new cellphone. Make sure to point out the connection these lists have to literacy skill development.
